bug.description:
It seems to me that there is a bug in the DepthWarper class (in the _compute_projection) function. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/arraiyopensource/kornia/blob/master/kornia/geometry/warp/depth_warper.py#L96>https://github.com/arraiyopensource/kornia/blob/master/kornia/geometry/warp/depth_warper.py#L96</denchmark-link>
z is to be actually computed as 1. / flow[:, 3] as opposed to 1. / flow[:,2]. (Recall that flow is computed from point, which is ordered on Line 93 of the same script as torch.FloatTensor([[[x], [y], [1.0], [invd]]]). This indicates that the inverse depth will lie at index flow[:,3], not flow[:,2].
